name: (2,2-dibromoethenyl)benzene
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4246
Reason: 1,2-propanediol, 3-(2-methoxyphenoxy)-, 1-carbam has a melting point of 92 degrees Celsius. The basic unit we can compare to is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 degrees Celsius. The additional functional groups and structural features in (2,2-dibromoethenyl)benzene will affect its melting point: (1) The two phenyl groups can add approximately +30 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure; (2) The bromine atoms can increase the melting point by approximately +10 due to the increase in molecular weight and the formation of a more rigid structure.
